Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label at least two different types of habitats, such as a land habitat (e.g., garden, forest) and a water habitat (e.g., pond, stream).
The student can include and label different types of living things in each habitat, like trees, grasses, flowering plants, lizards, birds, fish, or insects.
The student can use their drawing to show the variety of living things that can be found in each habitat, emphasizing the differences and similarities.
The student can represent patterns of plant and animal diversity by organizing living things in a way that shows how they exist in different places on land and in water.
